medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent epigastric pain and persistently elevated amylase levels.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began five months prior to admission, with episodes of epigastric pain. Amylase level was 349 U per liter at that time. The pain continued in bouts with amylase levels not returning to normal, reaching 355 U per liter at admission. No evidence of bowel obstruction or perforation was found.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Resection of the sigmoid colon 11 months prior due to diverticulitis. Recent weight loss of 5.5 kg and a tendency toward constipation and urinary frequency.
medical_history.family_history: Paternal grandmother died of 'stomach cancer,' but no history of pancreatitis in the family.
medical_history.social_history: Non-smoker, drank alcohol in moderation on weekends, and walked for exercise.
